name: Tennis Elbow 2013
description: Created by and for tennis fans, Tennis Elbow 2013 is a tennis simulation with an easy and intuitive learning curve, but with exceptional gameplay depth.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 10/8/7/Vista/XP Processor: 500 MHz Intel Pentium II or equivalent Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: 32-MB 3D card DirectX: Version 8.1 Storage: 100 MB available space Additional Notes: Keyboard, Mouse or Joystick
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 10/8/7/Vista/XP Processor: 2 Ghz or faster Intel Pentium 4 or AMD XP processor Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 128-MB 3D card DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 200 MB available space Additional Notes:

reviews.review_text: Key supplied by developer for review.   ======================================

If Virtua Tennis and Top Spin are like Call of Duty, then Tennis Elbow is like Arma. Realistic, hand crafted, and honest to what it portrays. No video game makes the tennis more real and challangeing. You can't walk in and expect to start winning everything. If you do a world tour it will take you time to build your character up to adaquate level to be able to compete. Also the system isn't arcady, it will certianly take some getting use to. However if you want the most honest tennis experience then look no further than Tennis Elbow.
This is Dark Souls of sports games.

When I first loaded this game up I thought, what on earth is this, very old fashioned layout, really annoying music. Just proves looks can be deceiving because this is by far the best tennis game out there. Very realistic and great customization. Only caution I may give people is the controls take some getting used to, it's not like Virtua or Top spin tennis where you can just button bash. On this game you have to time your shots, along with the movement of the player.   If you can persevere with the controls Tennis Elbow 2013 proves to be the best Tennis game out there, well for the time being anyway. Highly recommended!!
Simply the best tennis simulation game ever. For your arcade kicks, fire up virtua tennis or something, this is as close as you can get to real tennis without joining your local club.

This is by far the best tennis simulation i have ever played, Dont be put off by the lack of graphical fidelity because where this game shines is the mod support that really adds to the developer's solid base game with realistic animations,courts and player models. The learning curve is rather steep at first but after practice the game is magnificent and with continued mod support keeps improving. Thanks to the developer also who is very helpful on the games forum.  10/10
Tennis Elbow 2013 is a great game focused on simulating tennis, the way it's played in real life.
Currently the best tennis game on market including consoles.
Am I missing something? How do I play online? I don't see any options to play online!

Seriously one of the worst games I have played. I have been playing tennis games since the early 90s and have been suffering from the lack of good games of that specific genre. Sadly, this game has not helped.   - I do not care much about graphics but they are just ugly. Animations make me feel like it's 1994 again - I have never played a game with such annoying audio. The sounds are of low quality, do not fit and break the game - ugly UI & akward controls  If this would be open source, it would be an ok game. Demanding 20 Euro for this utter piece of software is just outrageous. I really tried to like it, but this game is just no fun
